description.S1: You've agreed to help open up an escape route for Cassandra.
description.S2: You'll need to find a keycard to unlock her pen gate and clear out either the Auntie Cleo security forces near the front entrance or the raptidons infesting the loading dock.
description.S3: The keycard can be printed from the security console terminal.

blurb.B1: If you help her, go back to Porter and use Persuade (45) to tell him they are standing down.
blurb.B2: You can tell him that you'll put in a good word for him and he'll pull out,
blurb.B3: you'll gain Covert Lab Security Keycard and 3333xp

description.S1: You found the needed keycard and opened up a route out of the lab for Cassandra.
description.S2: Unlock her door and inform her of her available escape routes.

blurb.B1: Talk to her after opening the door and Lie (30), Intimidate (51) or Persuade (21) to get her to give you the research (2000xp).
blurb.B2: Tell her you didn't save her for free and obtain 1200 Bit Cartridge.
blurb.B3: You can Persuade or Intimidate (both 31) to get her to give you a further 625 Bit Cartridge.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: You must think me a fool. I was watching on the security cameras. You got downright friendly with the outlaw leader.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I reckon we got nothing to say to each other. You best back yourself outta here. Nice and slow.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Ease off the trigger. Hear me out.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Nobody needs to die here. Least of all me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You sure you want to take me on?

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: You got one minute. Starting now.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I convinced Cassandra to let you leave in peace. The lab's a wreck. The staff's half-dead.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The outlaws just want to leave. Let them go.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> Fine. We'll do this the hard way.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Never mind. I'm leaving.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: You convinced *her* to let *us* leave in peace? Listing the ills we been done ain't exactly putting me in a mind to compromise.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Look around. Hasn't there been enough death?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I can't change what's done. I can change what happens from here. Just walk out.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You did your job. Probably better than anybody expected you to.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I gotta believe that all we done will mean something to the company. To Doc Crane. That effort'll make up for mistakes.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This isn't a cause worth dying for. You're meant for better.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You think the company cares about you? Or do they care about their lab? Their research?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Cassandra can't win. You can't win. Why throw more lives away?

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I trust that we all end up where we're supposed to be. That all the variables come together in the end.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I reckon I don't see any better solution. Fine, damn it. We'll pull out.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I've  worked for Auntie Cleo eighteen years. Done my best for them. Always expected they'd do right by us in turn.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I let them walk, Doc Crane'll be so far up my ass, everything will smell of flop sweat.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Think it's that easy, huh? You fly in with your fancy ship, say a few words, and everyone gets a happy ending?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I think it can be easy, if you decide to let it be.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't think walking away from a fight's ever easy.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: You ever had a good thing? A place it felt like you were supposed to be? I had that here.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm gonna guess you don't do it that often.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Don't reckon the company's gonna see it that way.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: They aren't here. I'll say you fought like hell.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Think about the people in this room. They're your responsibility.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Don't know how much that'll help, but I appreciate it.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Think I don't know my own responsibilities, mister?

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Tell your friends there's just two ways outta here. A cell or a box.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I ain't seeing a compelling reason to not blow your head off.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I don't want to take anyone on today. I'm just doing my damn job.
